section.title: Introduction
section.paragraph: This document outlines the procedure for cleaning a bicycle, covering preparation, the cleaning process itself, and post-cleaning requirements.

section.title: Preliminary Requirements
section.paragraph: Before starting, ensure the following are available:

list.item: Detergent (options vary based on bicycle type - see procedural steps)

subsection.title: Step 1: Initial Rinse
subsection.paragraph: Rinse the bicycle with water to remove loose dirt and debris.
Refer to Figure 1 for visual guidance.

subsection.title: Step 2: Detailed Cleaning
subsection.paragraph: Use a brush to access hard-to-reach areas such as shifters, tires, and brakes.
Remove caked grime from the chain and sprockets using a small blade screwdriver.

subsection.title: Step 3: Degreasing
subsection.paragraph: Remove grease from the freewheel assembly using a degreasing agent.
Apply the degreaser to the following parts:

list.item: Guide and tension wheels of the derailleur

subsection.title: Step 4: Rinsing
subsection.paragraph: Flush the sprockets, derailleurs, chainrings, and chain with water.
Repeat the flushing process if necessary.

section.title: Alternative Washing Procedures (Based on Bicycle Type)
section.paragraph: The following washing procedures are tailored based on the bicycle type (defined by `applicRefId`):

list.item: Soak a sponge in detergent and water.
Clean the bicycle with the soaked sponge.
Thoroughly flush the bicycle to remove all detergent residue.
Move the bicycle up and down on its tires to remove excess water.

section.title: Step 5: Lubrication
section.paragraph: Lubricate the bicycle according to the recommendations in the Data Module (DM):

section.title: Closing Requirements
section.paragraph: Ensure the bicycle is completely dry before use.

list.item: Detergent/Degreaser: Do not allow detergent or degreaser to come into contact with your eyes. If contact occurs, rinse immediately with clean water. Follow instructions on the container for proper usage.
Water Hose: Do not use a high-pressure water hose, as it may damage components.
Hub/Bottom Bracket: Avoid directing the water hose directly at the hub or bottom bracket bearings.
Paint: Apply detergent/degreaser in accordance with the container's instructions. Improper application may damage the bicycle's paint.
